questions.question_text:
A project manager is attempting to establish the proper sequencing and duration of project activities.
Which of the following would be the MOST beneficial?

discussion.content: Wouldn't "D. Gantt chart" be better?

I'm more inclined to agree with the provided answer. A Gnatt chart is basically a representation of a schedule that has already been established. The question is asking which should be used to establish a sequence. Gnatt chart is basically just a glorified calendar of events we already know the sequence of. Someone please correct me if I'm wrong.

A. Network Diagram

Gantt Charts already have the time defined. They show the relation of different tasks to each other. Their task dependencies, slack time, and so on.
A. Network Diagram: used to illustrate the sequence and dependencies for activities in a project.
The keyword is "establish", therefore Network Diagram is correct. Gnatt Chart shows items in order with duration, it isn't used to establish the duration of project activities.
D. Gantt chart - The Gantt charts shows both sequence AND duration. Network charts show only sequence.
A network diagram can be created to schematically show the sequencing of projects. Keyword in the question is sequencing. Therefore, the answer is A.

The keywords in this question are "sequence" and "duration". This makes "Network Diagram" much more appealing based on the Study Guide.

"One technique used by PM to sequence activities is a network diagram. A network diagram depicts the project activities and interrelationship amount these activities....A commonly used network diagramming method is precedence diagramming method (PDM).....Simple PDM network diagram of tasks with finish to start dependencies and task durations."
Source: Page 99 - CompTIA Project+ (PK0-004) Study Guide 2nd Edition. ISBN 978-1-119-28052-1
the answer is network diagram or gnatt chart?

I think I may need to agree that a gnatt chart is "MOST" beneficial as the question asks. A gnatt chart is far more clear than a network diagram. It offers dates where as a network diagram does not. A Gnatt chart has more to offer, a network diagram has less to offer. 

https://analysistabs.com/gantt-chart/vs-network-diagram/

A network diagram depicts the project activities and the interrelationships among these activities. Gantt charts - can show milestones, deliverables, and all the activities of the project including their durations, start and end dates, and the resources assigned to the task. (Comptia Project+ study guide, 2nd ed.)
Revisiting this. I think jerry47 might be correct. A Gantt chart is actually a type of network diagram along with the PERT diagram.

questions.question_text:
There are four parallel paths on a network diagram. The summary duration of each path is below:

A, C, G: 10 weeks -

A, B, F: 8 weeks -

D, E, H: 12 weeks -

D, B, F: 7 weeks -
Which of the following tasks are on the critical path?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct

"Critical Path" is the path of tasks that depend on each other and take the longest amount of time. It is critical because if any tasks in that dependency chain are delayed the entire project is delayed, thus critical path.
Answer is C. 12 weeks .Longest path is correct answer using Critical Path method.

discussion.content: Michael Jackson B.A.D

So, B. C, B,D,A is the correct answer. 
A requires B to start and finish per the initial statement, not description. And is also dependent on C. B is also dependent on C. Task B is 1 of Task A's predecessors. But B needs a predecessor as well. B or C could be possible but for D to fit in correctly, B is dependent on C. So now, C,B. D only requires the dependcy of Task A to C to no longer be applicable. Once that dependency is gone, D can start, but must wait for B to finish. C,B,D,A. but it seems D could work as well.
